description.narrative: Strengthen capacity development of SIDS stakeholders to engage with the private sector and enhance opportunities to build partnerships that can support SIDS to achieve SDG 14 and the overall objectives of the SAMOA Pathway.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Office of the High Representative for the Least Developed Countries

organisation.narrative: Permanent Mission of Denmark to the United Nations, New York, USA

mailing-address.narrative: Chrysler East Building, 666 Third Avenue, 11th Floor

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Development of knowledge product about private sector engagement and partnerships in SIDS and an evaluation of partnerships announced through the SIDS-GBN

Provide an assessment of trends in current level of private sector engagement in SIDS, share best practices and lessons learned and anticipate future needs and the role of private sector in supporting sustainable development in SIDS. Succesful partnerships will be showcased on the SIDS-GBN website to promote outreach and advocacy on the role of private sector in SIDS.

target.value: Knowledge product developed and published on private sector partnerships in SIDS

5 articles posted on SIDS-GBN website on lessons learnt and best practices on partnerships to implement SDG 14 in SIDS. 300 copies of the knowledge product disseminated to target audience. Evaluation of SIDS partnerships conducted and published online

title.narrative: In the short-term stimulat discussion and knowledge-sharing on networking and opportunities for cross-sectoral partnerships in SIDS. In the medium term, increase pool of resources and expertise available to SIDS through the GBN's expanded network of partners
Increased number of SIDS partnerships. Publication/knowledge product about SIDS private sector engagement

Strengthen capacity development of SIDS stakeholders to engage with the private sector and enhance opportunities to build partnerships that can support SIDS to achieve SDG14 and the overall objectives of the SAMOA Pathway

1. Improved capacity of SIDS national stakeholders to build partnerships with the private sector to tackle ocean sustainability challenges 2. Increase in the availability of information on trends and level of engagement of private sector in supporting sustainable development in SIDS 3. Increase in the number of partners joining the SIDS Global Business Network 4. Increase in the number of partnerships to achieve SDG14 in SIDS and the overall objectives of the SAMOA Pathway

target.value: SIDS-GBN platform is utilised to facilitate concrete partnerships to support SIDS in their implementation of SDG14 and the SAMOA Pathway
